markdown.markdown:
When I can find the time, I like to tinker! Below are some past and current projects started on the weekends or during internships, mostly made with R or R Shiny. I am currently honing my Python skills and also trying to learn Julia. I've only included my personal projects on this page. To see the R packages I created and maintain for work, check out the official [USFWS GitHub](https://github.com/USFWS). ::: {.grid} ::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-6}
gardenhelpr
![](images/gh_app.png){fig-alt="Screenshot of Garden Helper application" fig-align="center"} In development 2022-present [{{< fa brands github title = "GitHub link to Garden Helper repository" >}}](https://github.com/lawalter/gardenhelpr)

I started this R Shiny app to assist in backyard garden planning. Initially, I had an idea to calculate the mean pH requirements of all of the plants I was hoping to grow in my yard. As I did more research, I learned about the benefits of companion planting (and drawbacks to planting "enemies" together)! When completed, the gardenhelpr app will be able to take a list of plants a user is planning to grow and output both (1) ideal growing conditions (pH, soil, light, etc) as well as (2) any plant relationships and subsequent spacing recommendations.

::: ::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-6}
Colorband Combination Generator
![](images/app_img_m.png){fig-alt="Screenshot of Colorband Combination desktop app" fig-align="center"} Complete 2020 [{{< fa brands github title = "GitHub link to Colorband Combination Generator repository >}}](https://github.com/lawalter/colorband-app)

Created as a test case for my [r-shiny-electron-app](https://github.com/lawalter/r-shiny-electron-app) repository, this is a simple R Shiny app packaged with Electron that creates random color combinations for bird banding. Colors can be selected based on what's available in a banding kit, and selections are saved for future use via [shinyStore](https://github.com/trestletech/shinyStore).

::: ::: ## Miscellaneous ::: {.grid} ::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-6}
Shiny Electron App Creation Guide
Complete 2020 [{{< fa brands github title = "GitHub link to R Shiny Electron App repository" >}}](https://github.com/lawalter/r-shiny-electron-app)

I wrote a step-by-step guide to creating a desktop application with R Shiny on both macOS and Windows using Electron.

::: :::
